SEARCH
Package blackbox

Class Ray

java.lang.Object
blackbox.Ray
public class Ray extends Object
The Ray class is a non trivial class which handles the calculating and drawing rays on the board. The Ray class does not directly extended the JavaFX Line class and instead uses an ArrayList of coordinates to construct an ArrayList of Lines.

    • Ray

      cell - Cell object within which Ray is spawned
      torchCreator - the number of the torch that created the ray

  • Method Details

    • checkCollisions

      private void checkCollisions(Direction dir, Cell cell)
      Recursive method that computes path of the ray. This method of finding the path is based on the assumption that any ray cast into the board passes through the midpoint of any Cell it crosses. We use a "virtual pointer" which tells us where the Ray's path finding is currently at and a direction to recursively reach either the end of the board or an absorption.
      Parameters:
      dir - current direction of the ray
      cell - current cell virtual pointer is at

    • slopeToDirection

      p2 -
      Returns:

      public double distanceBetween(double[] p1, double[] p2)
      Finds the distance between two points
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      d between p1 -> p2, as a double

    • oneAtomReflection

      public Direction oneAtomReflection(Direction dir, double[] p1, double[] p2)
      Handles 60° reflections by manipulating the Direction enum type
      Parameters:
      dir - direction before reflection
      p1 - center point of cell the recursion is currently at
      p2 - center point of atom
      Returns:
      new computed direction

    • twoAtomReflection

      public Direction twoAtomReflection(Direction dir, double[] p1, double[] p2, double[] p3)
      This method handles 120° reflection AND total internal reflection for two atom collisions
      Parameters:
      dir - direction before reflection
      p1 - center point of cell the recursion is currently at
      p2 - center point of atom 1
      p3 - center point of atom 2
      Returns:

    • fullReflection

      public Direction fullReflection(Direction dir)
      Finds 360° reflection of ray by inversing current Direction
      Parameters:
      dir - direction to inverse
      Returns:
      inversed direction

    • addFinalPoint

      private javafx.util.Pair<Double,Double> addFinalPoint(Cell c)
      Computes the final point the Ray most cross in order to meet the edge of the board. This is done by taking the final Cell the Ray crossed and finding the codirectional Torch assigned to that Cell's midpoint.
      Parameters:
      c - final Cell the Ray crossed
      Returns:
      point required to meet edge of the board, or null if the Ray was absorbed

    • drawRays

      public void drawRays()
      Iterates over the points gathered by recursion and essentially draws a JavaFX Polyray

      public void toggleOn()

      public javafx.util.Pair<Double,Double> getFlagPos()
      Returns:
      null if the ray was absorbed, the exit position of the ray otherwise
